verses.roman:
tatas tu bhagavān kṛṣṇo
vayasyair vraja-bālakaiḥ
saha-rāmo vraja-strīṇāṁ
cikrīḍe janayan mudam

synonyms: tataḥ—thereafter; tu—but; bhagavān—the Supreme Personality of Godhead; kṛṣṇaḥ—Lord Kṛṣṇa; vayasyaiḥ—with Their playmates; vraja-bālakaiḥ—with other small children in Vraja; saha-rāmaḥ—along with Balarāma; vraja-strīṇām—of all the ladies of Vraja; cikrīḍe—played very happily; janayan—awakening; mudam—transcendental bliss.
translation: Thereafter, Lord Kṛṣṇa, along with Balarāma, began to play with the other children of the cowherd men, thus awakening the transcendental bliss of the cowherd women.

purport.content: The word saha-rāmaḥ, meaning "along with Balarāma," is significant in this verse. In such transcendental pastimes, Kṛṣṇa is the chief hero, and Balarāma provides additional help.
